21 Nov 2012

I Learned to Lilly Dip on Lake Couchiching: Ontario Lakes Project

By in category

Lake Couchiching has a special place in my heart. I was a camper at Camp Wahanowin in Orillia Ontario from eight years old for five consecutive summers. Digging through the archives, I was pleased to discover that I had received an Achievement Award for Canoeing on Lake Couchiching (that and an Award for Woodworking).

 

That Award must have been a charitable gift of sorts because I can assure you, I was not an enthusiastic canoeist. At best, I was a reluctant lily dipper. But all of these years later, I’m touched that someone, somewhere, thought to give me an award for my efforts–and of course for acknowledgement of my serious woodworking skills.

While I didn’t enjoy the temperature of Lake Couch, or being forced to swim laps with waves crashing into my face as I did one more lap of the crawl across its shores, I loved Camp Wahanowin and the childhood experiences I had there. Because Lake Couch was part of that experience it will forever have a very special place in my heart.

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
